name: Aaryan Patel
aboutMe: I build systems that scale. Fluent in C++, Python, and JavaScript, I'm fascinated by distributed architectures, high-performance computing, and AI systems. From optimizing memory management and concurrent processing to designing fault-tolerant distributed systems and training models at scale, I live for the challenge of making complex systems run faster and more reliably. I thrive on solving problems that better the lives of others.

courses.name: Designing Functional Programs
desc: Introduction to the fundamentals of computer science through functional programming, emphasizing elementary programming patterns
Exploration of syntax, semantics, and tracing program execution using substitution methods
Coverage of software development practices, including design, testing, and documentation
Study of both linear and nonlinear data structures, with a focus on recursive data definitions
Examination of key principles like abstraction and encapsulation
Analysis of different types of recursion, specifically generative and structural
Contextualization within the historical evolution of functional programming

courses.name: Elementary Algorithm Design and Data Abstraction
desc: Builds on techniques and patterns from CS 135, transitioning to imperative programming
Introduces design and analysis of algorithms, information management, and implementation techniques
Covers iterative and recursive sorting algorithms
Discusses data structures like lists, stacks, queues, and trees
Focuses on abstract data types and their implementations

courses.name: Object-Oriented Software Development (Enriched)
desc: Enriched introduction to object-oriented programming and tools for software development
Covers designing, coding, debugging, testing, and documenting medium-sized programs
Focuses on reading specifications and designing software to implement them
Involves selecting appropriate data structures and control structures
Emphasizes writing reusable code and reusing existing code
Introduces basic performance issues, debuggers, and test suites

courses.name: Data Structures and Data Management
desc: Introduction to widely used and effective methods of data organization
Focuses on data structures, their algorithms, and algorithm performance
Covers specific topics like priority queues, sorting, dictionaries, and data structures for text processing

courses.name: Foundations of Sequential Programs (Compilers)
desc: Explores the relationship between high-level languages and the underlying computer architecture
Covers basic machine architecture and assemblers
Includes specification and translation of programming languages
Discusses linkers, loaders, and block-structured languages
Examines parameter passing mechanisms and comparison of programming languages

courses.name: Computer Organization and Design
desc: Overview of computer organization and performance
Covers basics of digital logic design
Discusses combinational and sequential elements
Explores data representation and manipulation
Introduces basics of processor design and pipelining
Examines memory hierarchies and multiprocessors
